metadata.title: CVE-2019-15791 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In shiftfs, a non-upstream patch to the Linux kernel included in the Ubuntu5.0 and 5.3 kernel series, shiftfs_btrfs_ioctl_fd_replace() installs an fdreferencing a file from the lower filesystem without taking an additionalreference to that file. After the btrfs ioctl completes this fd is closed,which then puts a reference to that file, leading to a refcount underflow.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
